SENT.plain: We present a case of angiomyomatous hamartoma (AMH) in the popliteal region of a patient with Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome
A 14-year-old boy with a right popliteal mass and recurrent edema of the right leg was admitted to a local hospital where a diagnosis of Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome was made
Three lymph nodes in the right popliteal fossa were removed
Postoperatively, the patient was followed for 6 years
He had occasional mild edema of the right leg, but no signs of inflammation or recurrence of the angiomyomas
Our case is the first reported case of angiomyomatous hamartoma in a patient with Klippel-Trenaunay (KT) syndrome
